xxl.core.indexStructures

Class ORTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.indexStructures.Tree
      • xxl.core.indexStructures.ORTree
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BTree, MTree, RTree

    public abstract class ORTree
extends Tree
    The class ORTree (Overlapping Region Tree) is a generic and highly flexible super-class that implements features used by grow- and post-trees which stores objects with descriptors which may overlap.
    See Also:
    Tree

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ORTree.IndexEntry
      This class describes the index entries (i.e. the entries of the non-leaf nodes) of a tree.
      class  ORTree.IndexEntryConverter
      The instances of this class are converters to write index entries to the external storage (or any other DataOutput) or read them from it (or any other DataInput).
      class  ORTree.Node
      Node is the class used to represent leaf- and non-leaf nodes of ORTree.
      class  ORTree.NodeConverter
      The instances of this class are converters to write nodes to the external storage (or any other DataOutput) or read them from it (or any other DataInput).

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class xxl.core.indexStructures.Tree

        Tree.Query

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public ORTree initialize(ORTree.IndexEntry rootEntry,
                         Function getDescriptor,
                         Function getContainer,
                         Function determineContainer,
                         Predicate underflows,
                         Predicate overflows,
                         Function getSplitMinRatio,
                         Function getSplitMaxRatio)
        This is the basic method to create a new tree. It is not sufficient to call the constructor. Before the tree is usable, it must be initialized.
        Parameters:
        rootEntry - the new Tree.rootEntry
        getDescriptor - the new Tree.getDescriptor
        getContainer - the new Tree.getContainer
        determineContainer - the new Tree.determineContainer
        underflows - the new Tree.underflows
        overflows - the new Tree.overflows
        getSplitMinRatio - the new Tree.getSplitMinRatio
        getSplitMaxRatio - the new Tree.getSplitMaxRatio
        Returns:
        the initialized tree (i.e. return this)
        See Also:
        (Tree.IndexEntry, Descriptor, Function, Function, Function, Predicate, Predicate, Function, Function)

      • initialize

        public ORTree initialize(ORTree.IndexEntry rootEntry,
                         Function getDescriptor,
                         Container container,
                         int minCapacity,
                         int maxCapacity)
        Initializes the tree. Both Functions getContainer and determineContainer are initialized with constant functions: → Container which always return the given container. The predicate Tree.underflows is initialized with: 
        
                        new AbstractPredicate() {
                                public boolean invoke (Object node) {
                                        return ((Tree.Node)node).number() < minCapacity; //or > in case of overflow
                                }
                                }
        Tree.getSplitMinRatio is defined as: 
        
                                new AbstractFunction() {
                                        public Object invoke (Object node) {
                                                return new Double(minCapacity/(double)((Tree.Node)node).number());
                                        }
                                }
        Tree.getSplitMaxRatio is defined as: 
        
                        new AbstractFunction() {
                                public Object invoke (Object node) {
                                        return new Double(1.0-minCapacity/(double)((Tree.Node)node).number());
                                }
                        }
        Parameters:
        rootEntry - the new Tree.rootEntry
        getDescriptor - the new Tree.getDescriptor
        container - used as constant for Tree.determineContainer
        minCapacity - is used to define Tree.underflows, Tree.getSplitMinRatio and Tree.getSplitMaxRatio
        maxCapacity - is used to define Tree.overflows
        Returns:
        the initialized tree

      • initialize

        public ORTree initialize(ORTree.IndexEntry rootEntry,
                         Function getDescriptor,
                         Container container,
                         int innerNodeMinCapacity,
                         int innerNodeMaxCapacity,
                         int leafMinCapacity,
                         int leafMaxCapacity)
        Calls Tree.initialize(Tree.IndexEntry, Descriptor, Function, Container, int, int, int, int) with the root descriptor.
        Parameters:
        rootEntry - the new Tree.rootEntry
        getDescriptor - the new Tree.getDescriptor
        container - used as constant for Tree.determineContainer
        innerNodeMinCapacity - is used to define Tree.underflows, Tree.getSplitMinRatio and Tree.getSplitMaxRatio for inner nodes
        innerNodeMaxCapacity - is used to define Tree.overflows for inner nodes
        leafMinCapacity - is used to define Tree.underflows, Tree.getSplitMinRatio and Tree.getSplitMaxRatio for leaf nodes
        leafMaxCapacity - is used to define Tree.overflows for leaf nodes
        Returns:
        the initialized tree
        Since:
        1.1

      • initialize

        public ORTree initialize(Function getDescriptor,
                         Container container,
                         int blockSize,
                         int dataSize,
                         int descriptorSize,
                         double minMaxFactor)
        Before the tree is usable, it must be initialized. This version of initialize takes basic informations about the size of the blocks and entries and calculates the capacity of inner and leaf nodes.
        Parameters:
        getDescriptor - the new Tree.getDescriptor
        container - the new Tree.determineContainer
        blockSize - the size of a block of the container in bytes
        dataSize - the size of an data object in bytes
        descriptorSize - the size of a Descriptor returned by getDescriptor in bytes
        minMaxFactor - the quotient between minimum and maximum number of entries in an node, e.g. 0.5
        Returns:
        the initialized tree
        Since:
        1.1

      • initialize

        public ORTree initialize(ORTree.IndexEntry rootEntry,
                         Function getDescriptor,
                         Container container,
                         int blockSize,
                         int dataSize,
                         int descriptorSize,
                         double minMaxFactor)

      • remove

        public Object remove(Descriptor descriptor,
                     int targetLevel)
        Removes the object from the target level whose descriptor equals the given descriptor.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - to specify the object
        targetLevel - the level on which the search has to stop
        Returns:
        the removed object

      • descriptor

        public Descriptor descriptor(Object entry)
        Returns the descriptor of a given entry. If this entry is an index entry its descriptor is returned, else the method Tree.descriptor(Object) is used to determine the descriptor of the entry.
        Overrides:
        descriptor in class Tree
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry whose descriptor is to be determined
        Returns:
        the descriptor of the entry
        See Also:
        Tree.descriptor(Object)

      • computeDescriptor

        public Descriptor computeDescriptor(Collection collection)
        Computes the union of the descriptors of the collection's entries. The method descriptor(Object) is used to determine the descriptors of these entries.
        Parameters:
        collection - a collection of objects
        Returns:
        the union of the descriptors of the collection's entries
        See Also:
        descriptor(Object)

        public Tree.IndexEntry createIndexEntry(int parentLevel)
        Creates a new IndexEntry.
        Overrides:
        createIndexEntry in class Tree
        Parameters:
        parentLevel - the level of the node in which the new indexEntry is stored
        Returns:
        a new indexEntry
        See Also:
        ORTree.IndexEntry

      • createNode

        public abstract Tree.Node createNode(int level)
        Creates a new Node which does not have any information except its level.
        Specified by:
        createNode in class Tree
        Parameters:
        level - the level of this node (i.e. the maximum distance to the leaves of the subtree)
        Returns:
        a new Node
        See Also:
        ORTree.Node

      • indexEntryConverter

        public Converter indexEntryConverter(Converter descriptorConverter)
        Gets a suitable converter to serialize the index entries.
        Parameters:
        descriptorConverter - the converter to serialze the descriptors
        Returns:
        an IndexEntryConverter
        See Also:
        Converter, ORTree.IndexEntryConverter

      • nodeConverter

        public Converter nodeConverter(Converter objectConverter,
                               Converter indexEntryConverter)
        Gets a suitable Converter to serialize the tree's nodes.
        Parameters:
        objectConverter - a converter to convert the data objects stored in the tree
        indexEntryConverter - a converter to convert the index entries
        Returns:
        a NodeConverter
        See Also:
        Converter, ORTree.NodeConverter

      • query

        public Cursor query(Descriptor queryDescriptor,
                    int targetLevel)
        This method is an implemtation of an efficient querying algorithm. The result is a lazy Cursor pointing to all objects whose descriptors overlap with the given queryDescriptor.
        Overrides:
        query in class Tree
        Parameters:
        queryDescriptor - describes the query in terms of a descriptor
        targetLevel - the tree-level to provide the answer-objects
        Returns:
        a lazy cursor pointing to all response objects

      • checkDescriptors

        public boolean checkDescriptors()
        Checks all descriptors in the tree.
        Returns:
        true if the check does not find errors, false otherwise

      • checkDescriptors

        public boolean checkDescriptors(ORTree.IndexEntry indexEntry)
        Checks whether all descriptors of a subtree are correct.
        Parameters:
        indexEntry - reference to the root node of the subtree
        Returns:
        true iff the descrptors are correct

      • checkDescriptors

        public boolean checkDescriptors(ORTree.IndexEntry indexEntry,
                                List descriptorList)
        Checks whether all descriptors of a subtree are correct.
        Parameters:
        indexEntry - reference to the root node of the subtree
        descriptorList - a list containing all descriptors on the path from the start index entry to the current index entry
        Returns:
        true iff the descrptors are correct

      • checkNumberOfEntries

        public int checkNumberOfEntries()
        Checks for each node in the tree whether the number of its entries is correct. This means that no overflows or underflows are detected.
        Returns:
        the number of nodes which have over- respectively underflows.

      • checkNumberOfEntries

        public int checkNumberOfEntries(ORTree.Node node,
                                Stack path)
        Checks for each node in the subtree whose root is the given node, whether the number of its entries is correct. This means that overflows or underflows are not detected.
        Parameters:
        node - the node by which the checking must start
        path - the path from the tree's root to the given node
        Returns:
        the number of nodes which have over- respectively underflows.
